articles.title: Spurs 'will get there soon' - Palhinha
articles.summary: Tottenham Hotspur midfielder Joao Palhinha talks to Kelly Somers about returning to the Premier League, and why he is not worried about their poor form.

articles.title: Glasner '100% committed' to Palace for rest of season
articles.summary: Oliver Glasner says he is "100% committed" to Crystal Palace for the remainder of his time as manager of the club.

articles.title: 'A big blow' - Grealish has stress fracture
articles.summary: There is no timescale on on-loan Everton winger Jack Grealish's recovery from a stress fracture in his foot, says manager David Moyes.

articles.title: FA fines Chelsea for Villa bottle throwing incident
articles.summary: Chelsea are fined £150,000 after an unidentified member of their staff threw a bottle towards Aston Villa's bench at the end of a Premier League match in December.

articles.title: Rodman 'becomes highest-paid women's footballer'
articles.summary: Trinity Rodman signs a new three-year deal with Washington Spirit that will reportedly make her the world's highest-paid female footballer.

articles.title: Hearts v Celtic, Gogic and Askou in focus - Scottish Premiership picks
articles.summary: Leaders Heart of Midlothian hosting champions Celtic is the highlight of the Scottish Premiership weekend, but St Mirren's Alex Gogic and Jens Berthel Askou are also in the spotlight.

articles.title: No disruption to fan safety in WSL alcohol trials
articles.summary: Trials providing supporters with the option to drink alcohol in the stands at Women's Super League games receives positive feedback on fan safety.

articles.title: Cvancara 'ready to go' for Celtic with Kenny a doubt
articles.summary: Martin O'Neill hints Tomas Cvancara will make his Celtic debut in Sunday's vital Scottish Premiership visit to Tynecastle with fellow striker Johnny Kenny doubtful because of a calf strain.

articles.title: Former Man Utd captain Zelem joins West Ham on loan
articles.summary: West Ham sign England midfielder Katie Zelem from fellow Women's Super League side London City Lionesses on loan until the end of the season.

articles.title: All your FPL stats and Premier League team news in one place
articles.summary: Every key bit of Premier League team news and the most important Fantasy Premier League statistics - all in one place.

articles.title: Who can discuss a free transfer in January?
articles.summary: Our Ask Me Anything team explain when a player can sign a pre-contract agreement and which clubs are at risk of losing players.

articles.title: How 'James Bond' might help Hearts overcome injury crisis
articles.summary: Are the Scottish Premiership leaders about to experience the true power of Jamestown Analytics in the midst of an injury crisis?

articles.title: Football Daily
articles.summary: Jonathan Pearce joins John Murray & Ian Dennis to talk football, travel & language.

articles.title: When to reintroduce Fernandes? FPL talking point
articles.summary: Manchester United midfielder Bruno Fernandes has been in fine form since returning from injury, but when should he be reintroduced by FPL managers?

articles.title: 'He's my son' - Emery on pushing Tielemans
articles.summary: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery plays down a heated touchline incident with midfielder Youri Tielemans after substituting him against Fenerbahce.

articles.summary: Relegation and city rivals St Pauli and Hamburger SV frustrate each other in a goalless draw that lifts the home side out of the mandatory relegation spots.

articles.title: Euros abuse made me not want to leave hotel - Carter
articles.summary: England defender Jess Carter says abuse of female footballers is getting worse and that she has had to step back from social media after receiving racist messages during Euro 2025.

articles.title: Record £1.7m prize money for Women's Champions Cup winners
articles.summary: The inaugural Women's Champions Cup winners will earn $2.3m (£1.7m), the biggest-ever single award in women's club football, says its organiser Fifa.
